Meanwhile this class<span class="line"><!---->There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<!----></span><br>does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<span class="line"><!---->does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<!----></span><br>overflow if the experiment is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->overflow if the experiment is enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<span class="line"><!---->Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<!----></span><br>this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<span class="line"><!---->this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1423634<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;

  * appropriate heading levels.

    text-decoration: underline;

  :host {

  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

However we kept the class<span class="line"><!---->This experiment has long since concluded. However we kept the class<!----></span><br>around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<span class="line"><!---->around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<!----></span><br><br>There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<span class="line"><!---->There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<!----></span><br>does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<span class="line"><!---->does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<!----></span><br>overflow if the experiment is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->overflow if the experiment is enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<span class="line"><!---->Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<!----></span><br>this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<span class="line"><!---->this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1423634<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1423634" title="GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow"><!---->Bug: 1423634<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I92856530213b2c0dfd3c63a0cbdff4a620c3dbcf<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I92856530213b2c0dfd3c63a0cbdff4a620c3dbcf<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:       </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {

          max-width: 1000px;

          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          }

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>

          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1423634: GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1423634: GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1423634#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Mar 14, 2023, 10:53 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

However we kept the class<span class="line"><!---->This experiment has long since concluded. However we kept the class<!----></span><br>around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<span class="line"><!---->around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<!----></span><br><br>There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<span class="line"><!---->There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<!----></span><br>does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<span class="line"><!---->does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<!----></span><br>overflow if the experiment is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->overflow if the experiment is enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<span class="line"><!---->Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<!----></span><br>this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<span class="line"><!---->this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1423634<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Meanwhile this class<span class="line"><!---->There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<!----></span><br>does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<span class="line"><!---->does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<!----></span><br>overflow if the experiment is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->overflow if the experiment is enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<span class="line"><!---->Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<!----></span><br>this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<span class="line"><!---->this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1423634<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"             Issue 1423634: GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1423634: GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      hedon...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2307602945" title="hedon...@gmail.com"><!---->hedon...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      hedon...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->hedon...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sat, Mar 11, 2023, 8:49 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 11, 2023, 8:49 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 11, 2023, 8:49 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1423634: GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 11, 2023, 8:49 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">

          <h1>

        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/c97744e90c388adcb2322bf29fcdc21bc92d94dc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/c97744e90c388adcb2322bf29fcdc21bc92d94dc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/c97744e90c388adcb2322bf29fcdc21bc92d94dc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>c97744e90c388adcb2322bf29fcdc21bc92d94dc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c97744e90c388adcb2322bf29fcdc21bc92d94dc"><!---->c97744e90c388adcb2322bf29fcdc21bc92d94dc<!----></a><br>Author: Jonathan Ross <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jonathan Ross &lt;<!----></span>jonross@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jonross@chromium.org"><!---->jonross@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri May 05 18:43:30 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri May 05 18:43:30 2023<!----></span><br><br>Remove GpuMemoryAblationExperiment<span class="line"><!---->Remove GpuMemoryAblationExperiment<!----></span><br><br>This experiment has long since concluded. However we kept the class<span class="line"><!---->This experiment has long since concluded. However we kept the class<!----></span><br>around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<span class="line"><!---->around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<!----></span><br><br>There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<span class="line"><!---->There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<!----></span><br>does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<span class="line"><!---->does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<!----></span><br>overflow if the experiment is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->overflow if the experiment is enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<span class="line"><!---->Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<!----></span><br>this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<span class="line"><!---->this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1423634<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report.           Internals>GPU
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">

          (was: Untriaged)

          Security_Impact-None Security_Severity-High

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->

          OS-Android

        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1423634#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Mar 14, 2023, 10:53 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by

However we kept the class<span class="line"><!---->This experiment has long since concluded. However we kept the class<!----></span><br>around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<span class="line"><!---->around to help reproduce a few bugs that were identified.<!----></span><br><br>There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<span class="line"><!---->There's currently no action on those edge cases. Meanwhile this class<!----></span><br>does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<span class="line"><!---->does not support Vulkan configs. Leading to a way to trigger stack<!----></span><br>overflow if the experiment is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->overflow if the experiment is enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<span class="line"><!---->Since we have no desire to run this again, and we don't want to leave<!----></span><br>this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<span class="line"><!---->this as a potential issue for Vulkan, we are removing it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1423634<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report. This issue appears to be stack exhaustion overflow and is not considered a security issue in Chrome's threat model. This report is unfortunately not eligible for a VRP reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>will attach details soon.<span class="line"><!---->will attach details soon.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>memory corruption in GPU<span class="line"><!---->memory corruption in GPU<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b>113.0.5638.0 <span class="line"><!---->113.0.5638.0 <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Canary<span class="line"><!---->Canary<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span class="line"><!---->Linux<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state->InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<span class="line"><!---->From the asan trace, it appears that if shared_context_state-&gt;InitializeGrContext fails then the GpuMemoryAblationExperiment can cause an infinite recursion, though I didn't fully explore the traces.<!----></span><br><br>It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <span class="line"><!---->It appears that GPUMemoryAblation is disabled by default and the trial that was running is finished, thus setting impact none. <!----></span><br><br>Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<span class="line"><!---->Setting high severity based on GPU process memory corruption but I don't know if there are mitigating factors (eg when will InitializeGrContext fail)<!----></span><br><br>Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<span class="line"><!---->Not sure what platforms this should be set on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          GpuMemoryAblationExperiment and Vulkan stack overflow
          (was: stack overflow in GpuServiceImpl)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<span class="line"><!---->The feature was never built for usage with Vulkan. We had to check for re-entrancy of InitializeGrContext for GL when building it.<!----></span><br><br>There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<span class="line"><!---->There's no plans to ever ship it/run the experiment again. We had only kept it around as it was useful for testing some edge cases offline.<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan would be Android/Linux so added that platform to list. There's also unfortunate stability issues with certain Vulkan drivers, so I can't be certain of why InitializeGrContext might be failing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
